summary: I am a Conflict Manager and a Community development specialist, with international experience in strengthening vertical and horizontal cohesion in society, and in peacebuilding and conflict resolution. My Major strengths include building new partnerships and increasing resilience to conflict and division while working with communities, governments, (local) NGOs. I Understands the strong need for direct dialogue between people when it comes to initiating and furthering processes and changing narratives. I have extensive experience in designing, developing and delivering training, mentoring and advising. Masters of Arts Christianity and Islam from Tilburg University, the faculty of Theology and very aware of the cultural sensitivity. I am selected as a Mission Expert for the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. In April of this year, I have completed my seconded contract at the Human Rights department with The United Nations at MONUSCO in the east part of the Democratic Republic of Congo. I am a Human Rights expert with international experience in addressing complex human rights violations. My Major strengths include protect and promote human rights, integrating gender perspectives specific women and girls' rights in programs and strategies, capacity building, building new partnerships and increasing resilience to gender-based violence, and stop impunity while working with authorities, governments and NGOs. I have experience in advocacy, monitoring Human Rights, developing and delivering training, and support human rights working groups. I have a master's degree from Tilburg University in Christianity and Islam and therefore I am very aware of cultural sensitivity in communicating with People living in an Islamic-oriented society.
